children.name: Beompae
children.description: Korean genre of Buddhist chants and songs performed by monks while celebrating religious rituals in temples.

children.name: Changjak gugak
children.description: Emerged in the mid-twentieth century as an attempt to preserve the sound of Korea's traditional music while adapting it to modern sensibilities and Western compositional norms.

children.name: Fusion Gugak
children.description: Traditional Korean Folk Music and Korean Classical Music combined with elements taken from contemporary styles of popular music and Western music.

children.name: Korean Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Korean people.

children.name: Korean Revolutionary Opera
children.description: Heavily influenced by Chinese Revolutionary Opera and supported by the North Korean government.

children.name: Oriental Ballad
children.description: Emerged in the late 1990s in South Korea, taking influence from more traditional forms of Korean Music.

children.name: Trot
children.description: Considered the oldest form of Korean pop, which derives its name from the Foxtrot-inspired beat, and might be influenced by Japanese Enka.
